title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B implied a split with Stefon Diggs during her Los Angeles concert on her 'Little Miss Drama' tour.
Cardi B and Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs, facing battery charges, pled not guilty in Massachusetts Dedham District Court and is due for a hearing April 1.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: UMass Amherst suspended a student for organizing a pro-Palestinian protest during a September 2025 career fair.
A judge ruled UMass likely violated the student's First Amendment rights and ordered the suspension lifted.
The protest targeted RTX recruiting, criticizing its role in manufacturing military technology used by Israel in Gaza.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes charged with motor vehicle homicide after Brockton hit-and-run that killed Alfredo Alves, 23.
Incident occurred after a night out at Brockton strip club; Hayes allegedly hit Alves and left the scene.
Hayes pleaded not guilty, posted bail after arraignment, and is on administrative leave pending court hearing March 31.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Turtle Wax headlight cleaning pads restored headlights but fogged up again in 3 months.
Meguiar’s Keep Clear Headlight Coating claims to prevent headlight re-fogging for up to a year.
AAA studies show badly fogged headlights can block up to 90% of light, suggesting cleaning as preventive maintenance.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway for charges including child rape and human trafficking.
Garcia pleaded not guilty and was released on $5,000 bail with conditions limiting contact with minors.
Massachusetts State Police High-Risk Victims Squad assisted in the arrest, according to Boston police.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide after a hit-and-run in Pittsfield on February 10.
Victim William Colbert, 69, was dragged four miles under Gross's vehicle and found dead near a local hotel.
Gross was arrested without incident; arraignment scheduled for Wednesday at Central Berkshire District Court.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Mass. Registry of Motor Vehicles offers a lottery for commemorative MA250 plates marking Massachusetts' 250th anniversary.
Residents can apply for the lottery at the RMV Online Service Center until April 17, 2026, with no entry fee.
1,000 plates are available, with winners announced in May and responsible for a $60 registration and $40 plate fee.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts introduces ChatGPT as an AI assistant for nearly 40,000 state employees, starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services.
Gov. Maura Healey states the AI aims to enhance government efficiency while ensuring data security and prohibiting training public AI models.
The National Association of Government Employees criticizes the rollout, expressing fears of job displacement and data privacy concerns.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles is closing its two Gardner, Massachusetts packaging facilities by September, resulting in 91 layoffs.
Garlock Flexibles, owned by Astara Capital Partners, was rebranded in 2023 and provides packaging for food and produce.
Astara Capital Partners acquired Garlock's flexible packaging operations in 2021, separating them from the paper and tissue business.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife Rhonda Dorgan and son Aidan Dorgan at a Pawtucket hockey game.
Three additional victims, including Rhonda's parents and a family friend, remain in critical condition.
Robert Dorgan fatally shot himself after being subdued by bystanders; police investigate his motives.
